title: fix: handle GitHub 403/429 rate limits in spore-to-seed upgrade
author: ElliotEtag

gist.headline: Patience is a virtue
gist.blurb: Our Spore-to-Seed upgrade bot now knows how to wait its turn when GitHub is busy, preventing crashes.
gist.summary: Implemented retry logic for GitHub API 403/429 rate limit responses in the user upgrade script.
gist.impact: Improves the reliability of automatic tier upgrades by preventing crashes during API congestion.
gist.visual_concept: The Pollinations bee waiting patiently with a tiny pixelated hourglass or clock next to a closed digital gate (GitHub). Represents the script pausing for rate limits.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the 8-bit bee mascot holding a tiny hourglass, waiting patiently by a digital gate. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and lavender gradient background. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting. Represents handling rate limits gracefully. Nostalgic, calm atmosphere.

image.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the pollinations.ai bee carefully tending to a glowing pixelated seed in a digital garden. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel mint gradient background. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Represents growth and reliability. Nostalgic but beautiful.
